description: '''Al Jeel''', also known as '''Jeel''', '''Geel''' (Egyptian Arabic), is an Egyptian alternative to foreign [[popular music|popular forms of music]] that developed in the 1970s. Modeled after foreign [[rock and roll]] and [[pop music]], Al Jeel became oriented around [[dance-pop|dance/pop]], and had a background similar to [[reggae]]. Al Jeel also included many distinctively Egyptian characteristics, somewhat related to past [[Music of Egypt|Egyptian musical]] influences. One of the most famous Al Jeel performers is [[Hamid Al Shaeri|Hamid El Shaeri]].
